intro: Ligusticum arenarium, commonly known as the sand chervil, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, hairy stems that grow up to 30 cm in height, often with a distinctive aroma. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided, resembling those of other umbelliferous plants. Ligusticum arenarium thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in dry, open habitats.
